intro: Galium parisiense var. nudum, commonly known as the naked wood-sorrel, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, trifoliate leaves. The plant produces clusters of white, five-petaled flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves and flowers are often used in traditional herbal remedies.
